channel.title: Overheating Maybe?
channel.description:
Recently, after completely formatting my whole system, I haven't been able to do any "heavy" tasks, like games, without a irrating beep from my cpu. It will beep once at first, until it almost gets constant, one beep after any beep. They each last about a second.
I'm guessing it due to my system over heating? Here's my system health status: Shutdown temp - 80C Warning temp - 75C CPU TControl - 65C System temp - 50C (Not sure about when playing games) CPu Fan speed - 2732 RPM System fan speed - 0 RPM CPU Vcore - 1.32V VDIMM - 1.82V
Tomorrow I will open it up and have a clean out. Anyone know a good way to get rid of test on senstive things?
thanks.

item.title: Overheating Maybe?
item.dc:creator: @cumescape cumescape
item.description:
@cumescape wrote:

I never knew a AMD Phenom 9760 Quad is shit, no I don’t have a uber cooling system idk why its so low. maybe the sensor is broken?

Read full topic

item.title: Overheating Maybe?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Uber cooling system or shit cpu?

Read full topic

item.title: Overheating Maybe?
item.dc:creator: @cumescape cumescape
item.description:
@cumescape wrote:

With my new comp I never go over 35C at 100% CPU.

Read full topic

item.title: Overheating Maybe?
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:7, topic:282216”][quote author=Fat Cookies link=topic=372890.msg2814653#msg2814653 date=1244215874]
Where did you get these temperatures from? Lots of cheap software manage to over or under estimate temperatures (I have tested this myself) so if possible retrieve temperature from the BIOS.
[/quote]

How did you test this, out of curiosity?[/quote]

I have Intel Desktop Utilities running because I was not aware of any other free monitors. The reason I got it because I had serious heating problems but then cleared the dust from the heat sink and tightened it up.
I then just downloaded HWMonitor from T4_'s advice and it was displaying temperatures up to 2C more than my Intel monitor. I don’t know what to trust however as I said before the Intel monitor was telling me some of my voltages were out of range when I started to run HWMonitor.

Read full topic

item.title: Overheating Maybe?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Fat Cookies:

Where did you get these temperatures from? Lots of cheap software manage to over or under estimate temperatures (I have tested this myself) so if possible retrieve temperature from the BIOS.

How did you test this, out of curiosity?

Read full topic

item.title: Overheating Maybe?
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

My BIOS adds the two cores together, so it gets like 70+C on idle. Linux cuts them in half, so I get -5C - 20C, CoreTemp gets it just right (30-37C)

Read full topic

item.title: Overheating Maybe?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:3, topic:282216”]Where did you get these temperatures from? Lots of cheap software manage to over or under estimate temperatures (I have tested this myself) so if possible retrieve temperature from the BIOS.

What CPU is this? Mine idles at around 50C but that’s surprisingly normal for my processor.

T4_, I don’t like HWMonitor because when I run it, my Intel Monitor tells me that some voltages are out of range.

edit: please answer 2nd question.[/quote]
He can still use HWMonitor even though you don’t like it, .

Read full topic

Those are the temperatures from the BIOS.

item.title: Overheating Maybe?
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:

Where did you get these temperatures from? Lots of cheap software manage to over or under estimate temperatures (I have tested this myself) so if possible retrieve temperature from the BIOS.

What CPU is this? Mine idles at around 50C but that’s surprisingly normal for my processor.

T4_, I don’t like HWMonitor because when I run it, my Intel Monitor tells me that some voltages are out of range.

item.title: Overheating Maybe?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

50C idle is pretty high. Try running HWMonitor by CPU-Z and leave it running while gaming. Once it beeps, close the game and check them temperature.

Read full topic

item.title: Overheating Maybe?
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Recently, after completely formatting my whole system, I haven’t been able to do any “heavy” tasks, like games, without a irrating beep from my cpu. It will beep once at first, until it almost gets constant, one beep after any beep. They each last about a second.

I’m guessing it due to my system over heating? Here’s my system health status:
Shutdown temp - 80C
Warning temp - 75C
CPU TControl - 65C
System temp - 50C (Not sure about when playing games)
CPu Fan speed - 2732 RPM
System fan speed - 0 RPM
CPU Vcore - 1.32V
VDIMM - 1.82V

Tomorrow I will open it up and have a clean out. Anyone know a good way to get rid of test on senstive things?

thanks.
